org.fpe4j

Interface FFX.RoundFunction

  • Enclosing class:
    FFX

    public static interface FFX.RoundFunction
    Pseudorandom function for Feistel rounds.
    Author:
    Kai Johnson

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] F(javax.crypto.SecretKey K, int n, byte[] T, int i, int[] B)
      Pseudorandom function for Feistel rounds.

    • Method Detail

      • F

        int[] F(javax.crypto.SecretKey K,
        int n,
        byte[] T,
        int i,
        int[] B)
 throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Pseudorandom function for Feistel rounds.
        Parameters:
        K - the encryption key of a type compatible with the underlying cipher
        n - the original length of the input
        T - the tweak
        i - the index of the current round, in the range [0..rnds(n)]
        B - the array partition to transform
        Returns:
        an array of the same length as A (i.e. n - B.length) with pseudorandom values in the range [0..radix]
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key is invalid or not compatible with the underlying cipher
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If n is not within the range [minlen..maxlen]; the length of T is not within the range of [minTlen..maxTlen]; the length of B is not within the range [1..ceiling(n/2)]; ; or any value B[i] is not in the range [0..radix].

      • validKey

        boolean validKey(javax.crypto.SecretKey K)
        Validates the key for the psuedorandom function.
        Parameters:
        K - the key
        Returns:
        true if the key is compatible with the underlying cipher.
